description.value: The purpose is to identify the particular factor of interest. Currently the possible factors for consideration and should be included are: • alcohol consumption • smoking • diet Other kinds of lifestyle factors may also be considered such as risk factors, exercise, exposure risks, or other types of dependencies such as drugs.

definition.value: The purpose is to identify the particular factor of interest. Currently the possible factors for consideration and should be included are: • alcohol consumption • smoking • diet Other kinds of lifestyle factors may also be considered such as risk factors, exercise, exposure risks, or other types of dependencies such as drugs.

Drug dependencies are not in the eHN Guideline; in some countries, Life Style factors are type of sensitive information that requires special confidentiality rules. Derived models may choose to use distinct elements for each description or to collect them into a single section level narrative block. For the description, narrative is typical but Coded and quantified information are given if possible. These will be further described by the Life Factor Details element (#5).
This will include the type of measurements applicable to the factor; for example, alcohol units consumed; for smoking, the number of packs smoked etc.

Life Style factors observations often span a considerable length of time. This attribute records the Interval of time the “lifestyle factors” described is referring to. Dates should have at least year precision. Example: from 1974 through 2004
